personal.name: Charlie De Buriatte
personal.title: IT Support Specialist & Systems Enthusiast
personal.tagline: From IT fundamentals to applied AI, built through real projects

bio.short: IT Support Specialist with 1.5 years experience in technical troubleshooting and systems administration. Building expertise through hands-on projects and continuous learning.
bio.medium: I'm building my career in IT by learning systems deeply and applying that knowledge through real projects. From home lab experimentation to AI-powered tools, I focus on understanding not just how things work, but why they work. My goal is to grow into roles where I can solve real technical problems and keep evolving.
bio.full:
I became genuinely interested in technology in my early teens, starting as a typical user before gradually becoming the person who fixed things. Gaming, building PCs, and experimenting with virtual machines sparked a deeper curiosity about how systems actually work beneath the surface. Over time, that curiosity shifted from using technology to understanding and building it.

Although I originally considered paths like healthcare or history, I found myself increasingly drawn to systems, infrastructure, and problem-solving. Building my own environments and troubleshooting real hardware issues, including diagnosing instability linked to Intel's 13th generation platform, strengthened my interest in technical problem-solving and persistence.

More recently, the rapid evolution of AI reignited that same curiosity. What began as casual experimentation evolved into using AI tools to build practical projects and improve workflows. Today, I'm focused on developing strong IT fundamentals while continuing to explore how modern tools, including AI, can enhance real-world systems and operations.
bio.what_drives_me: I'm driven by understanding how systems work and improving them over time. I enjoy solving technical problems, especially when the solution isn't immediately obvious. Contributing to the smooth operation of technology, even behind the scenes, is something I find genuinely rewarding.

projects.title: Job Application Analyser
projects.tagline: Privacy-first web app that scores your CV against any job posting
projects.description: A web application that analyses job postings against your CV using weighted scoring algorithms to provide data-driven application recommendations. Upload your CV once, paste any job description, and get an instant compatibility score (0-100%) with detailed skill analysis, application tracking, and CV improvement tools — all running entirely in your browser.
projects.long_description:
Job Application Analyser helps job seekers make objective decisions about which positions to apply for. Built with privacy as a priority — all processing happens in your browser with no data sent to servers. The intelligent weighted scoring algorithm treats required skills as 3x more important than preferred skills (reflecting real hiring priorities) and adds experience bonuses up to 20 points.

Originally developed as a Firefox browser extension, the project pivoted to a web application in v2.0 for universal access and better user experience. Since then it has grown into a full job search toolkit: an application tracker with pipeline stages, a recurring skill gap analyser, shareable results links, a PWA for mobile install, and a bookmarklet for one-click analysis from any job listing.
features: DOCX and PDF CV upload, or paste text directly
Skill editor — review, add, or remove extracted skills before analysing
CV parse preview — see name, roles, and experience years before committing
Application tracker with pipeline stages: Saved → Applied → Interview → Offer / Rejected
Notes per job entry, saved automatically to localStorage
Search and filter history by title, company, or pipeline status
Export full application history as CSV
Recurring skill gaps — bar chart of skills missing across recent analyses
Keyword suggestions — one-click copy of missing skills as bullet points for your CV
Shareable results links — compressed URL anyone can open to see your full results
PWA — installable on Android and iOS, opens full-screen, works offline
Bookmarklet — drag to bookmarks bar, click on any job listing to pre-fill the analyser
Role fit summary — plain-English explanation of your score
Dark mode with full responsive mobile layout
projects.why_built: To solve the problem of objectively evaluating job opportunities. Instead of guessing whether you're qualified, get a data-driven match score based on your actual skills and experience. Built because I needed it during my own job search.
challenges_solved: Designed weighted scoring system to prevent gaming (can't hit 100% on preferred skills alone)
Pivoted architecture from Firefox extension to universal web application
Implemented robust DOCX and PDF parsing with skill extraction and experience calculation
Built shareable compressed result links using LZ-String (60-80% size reduction)
Implemented full PWA with service worker, manifest, and offline support
Built bookmarklet flow — bypassed React's javascript: URL sanitiser via useRef DOM access
Solved CV and history persistence across sessions using localStorage
Fixed critical recommendation threshold bug (100% match was showing 'maybe')
Designed application tracker with pipeline stages, notes, search, and CSV export
Built recurring skill gap engine aggregating missing skills across all history entries
results_impact: Shipped v2.0.0 public release on Vercel with full feature set stable
20+ commits shipped across Feb 2026 — 4 major feature stages delivered
Transitioned from Firefox-only extension to all browsers including mobile
Full job search toolkit: analysis, tracking, CV improvement, and reach features
PWA installable on Android and iOS with offline support
projects.portfolio_notes: Demonstrates: Full-stack web development, TypeScript proficiency, algorithm design, privacy-first architecture, PWA development, state management with Zustand, iterative product development, Vercel deployment, modern React 19 patterns, localStorage persistence, data compression
future_plans: Job URL parsing — paste a LinkedIn/Indeed URL and fetch the job description automatically
Claude API integration — cover letter generation and CV tailoring suggestions
Salary banding — extract salary from job description and flag relative to market rate

projects.title: Hjelply — Community Support Platform
projects.tagline: Full-stack mutual aid network with points economy and trust progression
projects.description: A full-stack community platform connecting people who need help with those who can provide it. Built around a points-based economy with escrow, a 5-tier trust progression system, and a complete admin moderation panel. Currently paused to focus on higher-priority projects.
projects.long_description:
Hjelply is a demonstration mutual aid network designed for individuals who need flexible peer-to-peer support. Users can both request and offer help — posting tasks, earning points, and building trust through a structured reputation system.

The name is a placeholder with a nice ring to it — inspired by the Norwegian word for help ('hjelp'), courtesy of a Norwegian girlfriend. Built to explore the real complexity behind fair exchange systems, user trust, and accessible UI design for a sensitive user group.
features: Points-based economy with escrow (held until task completion)
Rating, review and dispute resolution system

metrics.stack: Full-stack with separate frontend, backend and database services

projects.why_built: To explore the complexity of building a real platform — fair economy design, user trust systems, multi-service architecture, and accessible design for a sensitive audience.
challenges_solved: Designing a points economy that can't be easily gamed
Building meaningful trust/reputation progression with real requirements
Full-stack architecture with separate frontend and backend services
Complex database schema for users, tasks, points, tiers and auditing
Containerising the entire stack with Docker Compose
JWT authentication with secure password hashing
Mobile responsiveness across admin and user-facing pages
projects.why_paused: Paused to focus on projects more directly relevant to getting into work, primarily the Job Application Analyser. Core functionality is complete.
projects.portfolio_notes: Demonstrates: Full-stack development, database design, API architecture, authentication, complex business logic, Docker infrastructure, TypeScript across the entire stack
